intro: Pentameris micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered pentameris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features a slender, upright stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, characteristic of the carrot family. Pentameris micrantha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
